block.p: COCA-COLA, Atlanta, named Alex Cummings, region manager for Nigeria, president at its Northern Africa group. He succeeds Brendan Harris, who was named president at its Italy-Alpine group this year.

HEINEKEN, White Plains, named Frank Van der Minne, who most recently led its Central and Eastern European regions, to the posts of president and chief executive at its Heineken USA unit. He succeeds Michael Foley, who is leaving to become chief executive at Aer Lingus.
COCA-COLA, Atlanta, named Alex Cummings, region manager for Nigeria, president at its Northern Africa group. He succeeds Brendan Harris, who was named president at its Italy-Alpine group this year.

HEINEKEN, White Plains, named Frank Van der Minne, who most recently led its Central and Eastern European regions, to the posts of president and chief executive at its Heineken USA unit. He succeeds Michael Foley, who is leaving to become chief executive at Aer Lingus.

OFFICE DEPOT, Delray Beach, Fla., named Bruce Nelson, president at its international division, to the post of chief executive. He succeeds David Fuentes, who will remain with the company as nonexecutive chairman.

STAPLES, Framingham, Mass., named Edward C. Harsant, most recently president at its Canadian business depot unit, as president for North American superstores. He replaces James C. Peters, who had been president for United States stores, and was named president and chief operating officer at Ross Stores.
